channel.title: Home on Nura Kawa
channel.description: Recent content in Home on Nura Kawa

item.title: Machine Learning Experiments Done Right
item.description: A detailed guideline for designing machine learning experiments that produce reliable, reproducible results.

item.title: Linear Regression
item.description: A straightforward explanation of the linear regression model: how it is defined, how it is optimized, and when to use it.

item.title: Neural Networks
item.description: A simple explanation of neural networks: their definition, optimization, and use cases.

item.title: Visualization: European Mobility in 2020
item.description: An interactive custom visualization of European mobility in 2020 using d3.js.

item.title: About
item.description:
I received a Bachelor’s degree in Statistics from UC Berkeley and a Master’s degree from KU Leuven. During my studies, I developed an interest in Machine Learning, especially in reliability aspects such as explainabilty, privacy, and robustness. I explored those topics through my work as an AI Research Scientist at neurocat and my master’s thesis on a novel XAI method for classifiers.

In my free time, I like to read - here’s what’s on my bookshelf.

item.title: Projects
item.description:
• Security of AI Systems: an in-depth study on the security risks of transfer learning, including backdoor and adversarial attacks; in collaboration with the German Federal Office of Information Security publication

  • BerDiBa (Berlin Digital Rail Operations): a holistic digital twin for rail operations using innovative signal processing methods and Artificial Intelligence. My work focused on robustness assessment of AI modules in autonomous railway systems.

  • Localized Classmaps: a new Explainable AI method that enables an interpretation of the outputs of classification algorithms. code, publication
